# ğŸš€ Basic update workflow

1. Check file status  
   `git status`

2. Add all modified files  
   `git add .`

3. Commit with a message  
   `git commit -m "Blog updates"`

4. Make sure itâ€™s up to date with remote (rebase helps avoid conflicts)  
   `git pull --rebase`

5. Push changes to GitHub  
   `git push`

---

# ğŸ” Quick lookups

- Show summarized history  
  `git log --oneline --graph --decorate -n 10`

- See differences before commit  
  `git diff`

---

# ğŸ›‘ If a rebase goes wrong

- Abort ongoing rebase  
  `git rebase --abort`

- Continue after resolving conflicts  
  `git rebase --continue`

---

# ğŸŒ Check remote (always use SSH)

- Show current remote URL  
  `git remote -v`

- If it shows HTTPS, switch to SSH  
  `git remote set-url origin git@github.com:marcellini-celso/REPO_NAME.git`

---

# âš¡ Useful configurations (one-time)

- Always rebase when pulling  
  `git config --global pull.rebase true`

- Automatically stash local changes during rebase  
  `git config --global rebase.autoStash true`

- Show current branch sorted by last commit  
  `git config --global branch.sort -committerdate`
